text.div:
SHR Action Extension

An entry related to an action or intervention, whether potential or actual, past or future. An intervention is an action addressing a undesired health state, behavior, risk, or goal.

name: SHR Action Extension
title: SHR Action Extension
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: An entry related to an action or intervention, whether potential or actual, past or future. An intervention is an action addressing a undesired health state, behavior, risk, or goal.

element.definition: An entry related to an action or intervention, whether potential or actual, past or future. An intervention is an action addressing a undesired health state, behavior, risk, or goal.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
If content was generated during a patient encounter, related encounter is the encounter where the information was gained.
The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) the content.
The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.
The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
The ontological status of the intervention, e.g., performed/not performed, requested/not requested.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
An entry related to an action or intervention, whether potential or actual, past or future. An intervention is an action addressing a undesired health state, behavior, risk, or goal.
If content was generated during a patient encounter, related encounter is the encounter where the information was gained.
The person or organization who created the entry and is responsible for (and may certify) the content.
The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, as distinct from who created the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program.
The most specific code (lowest level term) describing the kind or sort of thing being represented.
A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
The ontological status of the intervention, e.g., performed/not performed, requested/not requested.
